vialab.SMT

Class SMT

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.SMT.SMT
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TouchClient

    public class SMT
extends java.lang.Object
    The Core class of the SMT library, it provides the TUIO/Touch Processing client implementation, specifies the back-end source of Touches via TouchSource, and the SMT library cannot be used without it. Use this class to add/remove zones from the sketch/application.

      • warnUncalledMethods

        public static boolean warnUncalledMethods
        This controls whether we give a warning for uncalled methods which use one of the reserved method prefixes (draw,pickDraw,touch,etc and any that have been added by calls to SMTUtilities.getZoneMethod() with a unique prefix). Default state is on.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(processing.core.PApplet applet)
        Initializes SMT, begining listening to a TUIO source on the default port of 3333 and using automatic touch source selection.
        Parameters:
        applet - The Processing PApplet, usually just 'this' when using the Processing IDE

      • init

        public static void init(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                        int port)
        Initializes SMT, begining listening to a TUIO source on the specified port and using automatic touch source selection.
        Parameters:
        applet - The Processing PApplet, usually just 'this' when using the Processing IDE
        port - The port to listen on

      • init

        public static void init(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                        TouchSource... sources)
        Initializes SMT, begining listening to a TUIO source on the default port of 3333 and using the specified touch sources.
        Parameters:
        applet - The Processing PApplet, usually just 'this' when using the Processing IDE
        sources - The touch devices to try to listen to. One or more of: TouchSource.MOUSE, TouchSource.TUIO_DEVICE, TouchSource.ANDROID, TouchSource.WM_TOUCH, TouchSource.SMART, TouchSource.AUTOMATIC.

      • init

        public static void init(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                        int port,
                        TouchSource... sources)
        Initializes SMT, begining listening to a TUIO source on the specified port and using the specified touch sources.
        Parameters:
        applet - The Processing PApplet, usually just 'this' when using the Processing IDE
        port - The port to listen on
        sources - The touch devices to try to listen to. One or more of: TouchSource.MOUSE, TouchSource.TUIO_DEVICE, TouchSource.ANDROID, TouchSource.WM_TOUCH, TouchSource.SMART, TouchSource.AUTOMATIC.

      • setTouchSourceBoundsActiveDisplay

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsActiveDisplay()
        Sets the touch fitting method for all touch sources (except mouse) to active display mode. Uses the window's current display. This is the default touch fitting method for all touch sources, except TouchSource.MOUSE.

      • setTouchSourceBoundsActiveDisplay

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsActiveDisplay(TouchSource... sources)
        Sets the touch fitting method for the given touch sources to active display mode. Uses the window's current display. This is the default touch fitting method for all touch sources, except TouchSource.MOUSE.
        Parameters:
        sources - The touch sources that should should be bound by this method

      • setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay(int index)
        Sets the touch fitting method for all touch sources (except mouse) to display mode. Interprets which display to fit to by the index in the graphics environment's display array.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the display to bind touches onto

      • setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay(java.lang.String id)
        Sets the touch fitting method for all touch sources (except mouse) to display mode. This uses the display in the graphics environment's display array that matches id.equals( device.getIDString()). The display id string format is different on every platform. It is recommended to use the indexed version of this function instead.
        Parameters:
        id - The string id for the desired display.

      • setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay(int index,
                                               TouchSource... sources)
        Sets the touch fitting method for the given touch sources to display mode. Interprets which display to fit to by the index in the graphics environment's display array.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the display to bind touches onto
        sources - The touch sources that should should be bound by this method

      • setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsDisplay(java.lang.String id,
                                               TouchSource... sources)
        Sets the touch fitting method for the given touch sources to display mode. This uses the display in the graphics environment's display array that matches id.equals( device.getIDString()). The display id string format is different on every platform. I recommend you use the indexed version of this function instead.
        Parameters:
        id - The string id for the desired display.
        sources - The touch sources that should should be bound by this method

      • setTouchSourceBoundsRect

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsRect(java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Sets the touch fitting method for all touch sources (except mouse) to rect mode. Use this function if you want to manually change the touch source bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - a rectangle describing the desired touch bounds.

      • setTouchSourceBoundsRect

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsRect(java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                                            TouchSource... sources)
        Sets the touch fitting method for the given touch sources to rect mode. Use this function if you want to manually change the touch source bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - a rectangle describing the desired touch bounds.
        sources - The touch sources that should should be bound by this method

      • setTouchSourceBoundsScreen

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsScreen()
        Sets the touch fitting method for all touch sources (except mouse) to screen mode. This fits touches onto the entire screen space, covering all displays.

      • setTouchSourceBoundsScreen

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsScreen(TouchSource... sources)
        Sets the touch fitting method for the given touch sources to screen mode. This fits touches onto the entire screen space, covering all displays.
        Parameters:
        sources - The touch sources that should should be bound by this method

      • setTouchSourceBoundsSketch

        public static void setTouchSourceBoundsSketch()
        Sets the touch fitting method for all touch sources (except mouse) to window mode. This fits touches onto the current window's space.

        public static int getRevision()
        Get the current revision number. This number increments once for each official release and pre-release.
        Returns:

      • passAndroidTouchEvent

        public static boolean passAndroidTouchEvent(java.lang.Object me)
        Redirects the MotionEvent object to AndroidToTUIO, used because current version of Processing (2.x) does not support registerMethod("touchEvent", target).
        Parameters:
        me - MotionEvent - the motion event triggered in Android
        Returns:
        Should the event get consumed elsewhere or not

      • setTouchDraw

        public static void setTouchDraw(TouchDraw drawMethod,
                                TouchDrawer... drawers)
        Sets the desired touch draw method. Any of the values of the enum TouchDraw are legal.
        Parameters:
        drawMethod - One of TouchDraw.{ NONE, DEBUG, SMOOTH, TEXTURED}
        drawers - the optional touch drawer parameter. only to be used when using TouchDraw.CUSTOM

      • getTouchDrawer

        public static TouchDrawer getTouchDrawer()
        Gets the object currently being used to draw touches.
        Returns:
        the object currently being used to draw touches. Null if the touches are not being draw with an object.

      • setTouchDraw

        @Deprecated
public static void setTouchDraw(TouchDraw drawMethod,
                                            int maxPathLength)
        Deprecated. use setTouchDraw( TouchDraw) and setMaxPathLength( int) as separate calls, rather than together.
        Sets the desired touch draw method. Any of the values of the enum TouchDraw are legal. Also sets the maximum path length to drawn.
        Parameters:
        drawMethod - One of TouchDraw.{ NONE, DEBUG, SMOOTH, TEXTURED}
        maxPathLength - The number of points on a touch's path to draw

      • setMaxPathLength

        public static void setMaxPathLength(int maxPathLength)
        Sets the maximum path length to drawn. Does not affect the textured touch drawer.
        Parameters:
        maxPathLength - The number of points on a touch's path to draw

      • setTouchSections

        public static void setTouchSections(int sections)
        Sets the desired number of sections of a drawn touch. Higher amounts result in smoother circles, but have a small performance hit. Note: this option is only obeyed when using TouchDraw.TEXTURED
        Parameters:
        sections - the desired number of sections of a drawn touch

      • remove

        public static boolean remove(java.lang.String name)
        This removes the zone given from the SMT, meaning it will not be drawn anymore or be assigned touches, but can be added back with a call to add(zone);
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the zone to remove
        Returns:
        Whether all of the zones were removed successfully

        This removes the zone given from the SMT, meaning it will not be drawn anymore or be assigned touches, but can be added back with a call to add(zone);
        Parameters:
        zones - The zones to remove
        Returns:
        Whether all of the zones were removed successfully

      • clearZones

        public static void clearZones()

      • draw

        public static void draw()
        Performs the drawing of the zones in order. Zone on top-most layer gets drawn last. Goes through the list on zones, pushes the current transformation matrix, applies the zone's matrix, draws the zone, pops the matrix, and when at the end of the list, it draws the touch points.

      • drawPickBuffer

        public static void drawPickBuffer(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  int w,
                                  int h)

        Parameters:

        y - the y position to draw the pickBuffer image at
        w - the width of the pickBuffer image to draw
        h - the height of the pickBuffer image to draw

      • pre

        public static void pre()
        Manipulates the zone's position if it is throw-able after it has been released by a finger (cursor) Done before each call to draw. Uses the zone's x and y friction values.

      • get

        @Deprecated
public static <T extends Zone> T get(java.lang.String name,
                                                 java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Deprecated. 
        This finds a zone by its name, returning the first zone with the given name or null. This will throw ClassCastException if the Zone is not an instance of the given class , and non-applicable type compile errors when the given class does not extend Zone.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected class of the zone
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the zone to find
        type - a class type to cast the Zone to (e.g. Zone.class)
        Returns:
        a Zone with the given name or null if it cannot be found

      • get

        public static Zone get(java.lang.String name)
        This finds a zone by its name, returning the first zone with the given name or null
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the zone to find
        Returns:
        a Zone with the given name or null if it cannot be found
